content.description:
Use the same start as

Mountain Camouflage

, but instead of working up, work right towards the right crack. Move your feet over, and use a good toe jam. Work up the crack or use the holds outside the crack. The climbing is easy and straightforward (it can be done in hiking boots).
content.location:
Do the same start as

Mountain Camouflage

, and move into the right crack.

content.description: Start on a good jug rail, and move your hands up to other good jug rails straight up the rock. From there, establish your feet, and move your right hand up to a slopey crimp. Get your left hand up near a bush at the top, and finish it out strong!
content.protection: A pad possibly (brought one but didn't really need it).
content.location: Start near the left crack of this boulder face near a high cluster of green moss (moss doesn't interfere with the problem). Establish your feet down low on good ledges.
